content.description: As a follower this route was scary. Climb up the crack with decent pro close to the ground then it gets chossy and sandy. Belay from the tree to the left.
content.location: Located on Fairytale Wall left around the corner from Three Blind Mice. If it doesn't look easy and short keep going.

content.description: This is one of the oldest climbs in the canyon that I know of. Climb straight up the crack in the dihedral until it becomes overhanging (5.6).  Make a bomber anchor in the roof, then traverse left under and clip the three old 1/4 leeper hangers, but don't expect them to do anything as the last two are spinners (crux). Make your way up to the top and belay off of the trees via a ton of webbing or cord.
content.protection: Rack .5 - 2 Camalots, hexes, nuts, slings, and a lot of webbing for the anchor using trees about 20ft back from the top and you may need to get creative.
content.location: The crack is in the corner to the left of the large overhang on the Fairytale Wall. Look for three bolts in a horizontal line about 25ft up.

content.description: Great fist-sized and larger jams for the first half depending on hand size. The crux is the transition from the crack to the opening below the roof via sketchy sloping holds. Once past the crux, move right and up the ledges leading to the roof.
content.protection: Cams to #4. Use lots of webbing to attach the anchor to the trees for the anchor.
content.location: Left facing dihedral just a few feet to the right of Three Blind Mice

content.description: Located on Horseshoe Cliff, Fairytale Wall is located around the corner from the parking lot and is home to several climbs including Three Blind Mice and Welcome to Greenville. Many top rope and trad possibilities exist . Rock quality is decent though I have had some holds break on me so be careful.
